div.l: Of herberwe and of ese as for her peny
The miller said agein if ther be eny
Such as it is yet ye shal haue your part
Myn house is streit but ye han lerned art
Ye can by argumentez make a place
A mile brode of xxᵗʸ foot of space
Lat se now if this place may suffice
Or make it room wᵗith speche as is you gise
Now Symond seid this Iohn be seynt Cutberd
Ay is thou mery and that is faire answerd
I haue herd sey men shall take of twa thinges
Such as he fynt or take swilk as he bringes
But specieally I pray the oost dere
Gete us som mete ⁊and drinke ⁊and make us chiere
And we wolen paien truly at fulle
With empty hond men may non haukes tolle
Loo here oure siluer redy for to spende
This Meller to the toun his douȝter sende
For Ale and bred and rosted hem a goos
And bond her horse it shuld namore goo loos
And in his owne chambre he mad a bed
With shetes and with chalons faire I spred
Nouȝt from his owne bed ten foot or twelue
His douȝter had a bed al by her selue
Right in the same chambre by and by
It miȝt be no bet and cause whi
Ther was no romer herberwe in the place
Thei soupen ⁊and they speken hem to solace
And drinken euer strong ale at best
Aboute midniȝt went they to reste
Wel hath this miller vernisshed his hed
Ful pale was he for dronken ⁊and nouȝt red
He yoxeth and he spekith throuȝ the nose
As he were on the quakke or on the pose
